title: 21 Killed in Fast-Moving Gaza Fire in Jabaliya Neighborhood
description: A family celebration turned deadly, and officials said that gasoline stored in an apartment fueled the fire and contributed to the high death toll.

title: Your Friday Briefing: MH17 Convictions
description: Plus, Nancy Pelosi leaves leadership and the week in culture.

title: Brittney Griner Transferred to Penal Colony Outside Moscow, Lawyers Say
description: The W.N.B.A. star, who has been detained in Russia since February, is facing nine years in a Russian prison on a drug charge.

title: The Surprising Afterlife of Unwanted Atom Bombs
description: The Biden administration has called for the retirement of the B83 superweapon, but nuclear experts say its most destructive parts will live on indefinitely in one form or another.

title: Dutch Court Convicts 3 of Murder for 2014 Downing of Airliner in Ukraine
description: The victim’s families drew some solace from the verdict, which placed responsibility for the tragedy squarely with Moscow, but the men found guilty may never be arrested.

title: Alaa Abd El Fattah, Egyptian Political Prisoner, Had Near-Death Experience, Family Says
description: Alaa Abd El Fattah, who is being given nutrients intravenously, told his relatives he collapsed in prison but planned to resume his hunger strike again.

title: Lab-Grown Meat Receives Clearance From F.D.A.
description: In a first step toward cultivated meat reaching dinner tables and restaurant menus, regulators said that a start-up company’s chicken was safe to eat.

title: What to Know As UK Unveils Budget Proposal
description: The government’s budget proposal, known as the Autumn Statement, will lead to £55 billion in tax rises and spending cuts to fill a massive funding gap. Here are five takeaways.

title: Alexei Navalny Says He Has Been Placed in Permanent Solitary Confinement
description: The Russian opposition leader has been jailed since March 2021 after surviving an assassination attempt that American intelligence agencies blamed on Russian security agents.

title: Meet the ‘Closer’ Who Finds the Right Words When Climate Talks Hit a Wall
description: Sue Biniaz is considered one of the most innovative American legal minds when it comes to climate negotiations. She once rescued a collapsing deal by using quotation marks.

title: Despite Warning Signs of a Deadly Crowd Crush, Korean Officials Didn’t Act
description: An analysis, based on official documents and parliamentary testimony, reveals a series of missed opportunities to prevent a disaster that led to the death of more than 150 people in Seoul.

title: Dutch Court Convicts 3 Men Over Downing of MH17 Plane in 2014
description: The verdict offers a bare measure of justice for the 298 people killed in the downing of the jet, but it may set an example for possible prosecutions of Russian crimes during the current war.

title: What the Unusual Midterm Elections Mean for Climate Action
description: A split Congress makes it unlikely that Republicans will undo Biden’s climate legislation, but they’re likely to try to slow it. There may also be room for agreement on infrastructure.

title: Myanmar Frees Former U.K. Envoy Victoria Bowman and Others in Amnesty
description: Among those released were Victoria Bowman, the former diplomat, and Sean Turnell, an Australian economic adviser to Myanmar’s imprisoned civilian leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi.

title: A Dutch court is delivering a verdict in the MH17 crash, which killed 298 people.
UK Announces Billions in Tax Increases and Spending Cuts
description: The government is betting that the plan will put public finances back on sound footing but acknowledges that the measures are likely to deepen the economic misery for Britons.

title: Why the Crypto Collapse Matters
description: The failure of the cryptocurrency exchange FTX put the entire industry under scrutiny.

title: Wounded Iranian Protesters Forced to Flee and Heal in Hiding Abroad
description: Most who took part in antigovernment rallies try to stay below the radar in their own country, but some, particularly those injured in the crackdown, have been forced to flee.

title: Russian Attacks on Ukraine’s Power Grid Endanger Nuclear Plants, U.N. Agency Says
description: The director of the International Atomic Energy Agency called the effect of the strikes on the energy grid “very concerning.”

title: 25 Travel Experiences That Should Be on Your Bucket List
description: A pair of internationally minded writers, a chef, an architect and a landscape photographer made a list of the most extraordinary adventures a person should seek out. Here are the results.

title: ‘Life Brought Me Here.’ Madagascar Adapts to a Changing Climate
description: Droughts, cyclones and floods have forced the people of Madagascar, a poor country in the southern Indian Ocean, to find new homes, new livelihoods and even new diets.

title: Verdict Due in Case of 2014 Malaysia Airlines Flight Shot Down Over Ukraine
description: Men with ties to the Russian security services are accused in the MH17 disaster, which happened in the midst of a conflict that foreshadowed Russia’s invasion of Ukraine this year.

title: What to Expect From the U.K.’s Budget Proposals Today
description: Tax increases and spending cuts are expected as the government tries to stabilize its finances and reassure financial markets.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Tensions over a missile blast in Poland are easing after an investigation that suggested it was an accident.

title: A Timeline of Events in the MH17 Plane Crash Investigation
description: The disaster claimed 298 civilian lives, and came in the midst of a conflict that foreshadowed Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

title: Article 4 and Article 5 of the NATO Treaty Explained
description: The provisions are core parts of the NATO charter, but are not often invoked.

title: As Russian Strikes Mount, Ukraine Works to Keep the Lights On
description: This week’s assault hit at least 15 energy facilities — some for the fifth or sixth time — forcing controlled blackouts in every part of the country.

title: Corrections: Nov. 17, 2022
description: Corrections that appeared in print on Thursday, Nov. 17, 2022.

title: ‘This Is Not Ukraine’s Fault’: Tensions Ease Over Missile Strike in Poland
description: NATO and Polish officials said that it was a Ukrainian missile that crossed the border and killed two people, but that Russia bore the blame.
